pageContext.claim: “One of the children [who died in custody] -- the father gave the child no water for a long period of time. He actually admitted blame. The other one was being brought to the hospital in an emergency -- on an emergency basis.”
pageContext.analysis: News reports say one child who died had the flu and the other, Jakelin Caal Maquin, died from a bacterial infection. Maquin's father had disputed earlier claims that she wasn't given enough water along the journey to the border. An autopsy report released March 29 found that she was suffering from a bacterial infection that was so advanced she probably would have been visibly sick for many hours.
